snippet: The announcement on Monday was the first official confirmation from the Russian government that the Iskander systems may already be deployed within striking distance of NATO countries in Europe.
abstract: Russian Defense Ministry says it has deployed short-range ballistic missiles in the country's west, move that it contends does not violate international treaties; deployment could conceivably allow Russia to carry out a precise strike on some NATO countries.
lead_paragraph: The announcement on Monday was the first official confirmation from the Russian government that the Iskander systems may already be deployed within striking distance of NATO countries in Europe.

headline.main: Deployment of Missiles Is Confirmed by Russia
headline.print_headline: Deployment Of Missiles Is Confirmed By Russia
